metadata.title: CVE-2024-2201 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
[x86: Native Branch History Injection]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-2201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-256-generic - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-256-generic - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-256-lowlatency - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-aws - 4.4.0-1133.139
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1178-azure - 4.15.0-1178.193~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.139').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1178.193~14.04.1').
